entry.title: Pashinyan meets with Pope Francis in Vatican City

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan meets with Pope Francis in Vatican City
media:group.media:description:
ğŸ“ U.S. Representative Frank Pallone faced government-sponsored protests and was deliberately excluded from a bipartisan meeting with Azerbaijani President Aliyev during the ongoing COP29 climate conference in Baku. ğŸ“ Ludwig Gulnazaryan, the mayor of Parakar, a town near Yerevan, resigned yesterday after reportedly being involved in a deadly shooting over the weekend. He is not suspected of murder. ğŸ“ Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan met with Pope Francis at the Vatican yesterday for private discussions centered on regional peace and Armenian prisoners of war.

entry.title: How Armenia is preparing to navigate the new Trump era

media:group.media:title: How Armenia is preparing to navigate the new Trump era
media:group.media:description:
In this CivilNet podcast, political analyst Eric Hacopian provides in-depth analysis of two major developments shaping Armenia's political landscape - the government's surprise dismissal of six ministers in a single day, and the implications of Donald Trump's election victory in the United States. Hacopian examines the motivations behind the ministerial purge, the broader patterns of turnover in Armenian politics, and what these upheavals signal about the country's precarious position. The discussion then pivots to exploring how Trump's presidency could impact Armenia's diplomatic and strategic interests.

entry.title: Cox Rehabilitation Center moves operations from Artsakh to Armenia

media:group.media:title: Cox Rehabilitation Center moves operations from Artsakh to Armenia
media:group.media:description:
The Caroline Cox Rehabilitation Center, which had been operating in Artsakh for 25 years, has moved to Armenia. Their current work focuses around visiting homes and providing rehabilitation treatments to those injured during the ethnic cleansing in Artsakh Additionally, in collaboration with UNICEF, they are working with one hundred children with mental and physical challenges. On October 30, the center acquired a large building in Yeghvard, Armenia, in order to continue their work long-term.

entry.title: Armeniaâ€™s uphill battle for police reform

media:group.media:title: Armeniaâ€™s uphill battle for police reform
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of the Civilnet podcast, the head of the Union of Informed Citizens, Daniel Ioanissyan, provides a comprehensive look at the state of police reform, anti-corruption efforts, and road safety in Armenia. They discuss the key changes implemented by the government, the obstacles faced in carrying out meaningful change, and the organization's role in advocating for greater transparency and accountability within law enforcement. The conversation also delves into the alarming traffic death crisis plaguing the country, exploring potential solutions and the political will, or lack thereof, to address this critical issue.

entry.title: Inspiring stories of hope and sacrifice from the Aurora Humanitarian Initiative

media:group.media:title: Inspiring stories of hope and sacrifice from the Aurora Humanitarian Initiative
media:group.media:description:
Partner content
The Aurora Humanitarian Initiative, in collaboration with UCLAâ€™s The Promise Institute for Human Rights, hosted a Tribute to Humanitarians during the Human Rights and Humanitarian Forum in Los Angeles this past May. This event honored three exceptional humanitarians who have dedicated their lives to defending human rights and offering hope to the most vulnerable across Bahrain, Iran, and the Democratic Republic of Congo. Watch as key panelists, including Armine Afeyan, the Executive Director of the Aurora Humanitarian Initiative, Hannah Garry, Executive Director of The Promise Institute for Human Rights at UCLA Law and Dele Olojede, Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist and member of the Aurora Prize Selection Committee, share insights into these humanitariansâ€™ work and how they continue to inspire hope in a world filled with conflict and injustice.
